page.title: 11The Bowes By_pass
page.content: The biggest event in Bowes in recent years was the opening in 1982 by Sir Timothy Kitson M.P. of the Bowes by_pass.This long awaited event now means that traffic no longer rumbles through the village on the A66 trunk road.There used to be a lot of accidents and some people were killed but now the main street is quiet and children can play safely.A local businessman ,Mr. Alderson,who runs the garage thinks the village will slowly decline but there is some evidence that property prices are rising and more people are attracted to a village which is not polluted by petrol and diesel fumes and the constant thunder of traffic.
